title: Latest Windows 10 Update (V. 1709) Causing In-Game Lag. Need Help.
body: Hi, I've recently updated my windows 10 operating system a couple of days ago, and ever since then I've been getting lag spikes and delay within said lag spikes but only within the League of Legends game. Not the client, not the loading screen, but whilst playing the game itself. I've followed many steps (including all of the ones in this link -https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting-) and read countless information about how to remedy the problem but nothing so far has helped. I know there is probably somebody out there who can help me or maybe not since this is a problem caused by Microsoft's end, but hopefully someone can help me. The reason I know its not my internet service and its Microsoft is because everything else runs fine, all of my other devices, programs, and games on my computer run the same if not better after doing all that I can to fix the lag spikes within LoL. Any help at all will be appreciated, I will do anything to fix this lag. LoL is my favorite game above all.

replies.body:
Since you recently updated, it could actually be a number of different things. I've seen Windows updates normally turn on the Game DVR function which can slow a lot of systems down unintentionally, so be sure that's still disabled.

Also, be sure to double check your [**firewalls**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq3) and [**DNS settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq4) to be sure they're still in order. I know you may not have changed anything, but it's better to check and be safe rather than miss something simply of course!

Let me know if this is helping or not, if not it just means we will have to dig a little deeper but it's good to cover the basics first!

I'm not sure how check or tamper with the "Game DVR function". So I will have to put that on hold for the time being. I just got done doing my errands today so I'm going to try testing the game right now, wish me luck!
It's a little old, but try [**this article**](https://www.windowscentral.com/how-disable-and-remove-game-bar-windows-10-creators-update) for help with the Game Bar!
Oh thanks! Fortunately mine was already off, so I don't think that's the issue. I'm going to try the firewalls and DNS settings. I'll get back to you once I've found out if it helps or not.
Send you logs and info to riot support instead of redownloading, its much more easier
It's too late for that. I already reinstalled the game. It only takes 10-15 minutes for my computer to install the game (patches included).

Got the patches downloading right now, 20% completed so far. I'll play a vs bot game and let yall know asap if this works or not. If not, then I give up. I cant play my PS4 anymore btw because I work on alaskan fishing boats as a processor and my left thumb can no long move the analog stick down right. So good-bye console gaming.

Yeah...early today My windows decided to apply the latest updates, and since then I'm unable to play league of legends too...I keep getting Unable to Connect on the loading screen, anfter a couple of "retry" I'm actually able to join the game, but still unable to play, because it keeps saying "Attempting to Reconnect", non-stop....The game was working just fine until yesterday, so it's either the windows update, or the 8.2 LoL patch.
Everything else seems to work just fine without any problem, I even tryed out a couple of other online games and I can play them without any issue as well.
It took me a while to uninstall LoL because I've been busy, but I'm almost down reinstalling League. I'll let you all know if this helps.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

I've found that deleting A LOT of unnecessary files and folders to programs that I don't even use or remember downloading/installing to help me a lot with all around computer speed. No surprise there... but I'm hoping it helps with my lag problem in league as well.

> [{quoted}](name=GrimzReaper420,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=G3YQZuEd,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-01-24T23:18:42.829+0000)
>
> I've found that deleting A LOT of unnecessary files and folders to programs that I don't even use or remember downloading/installing to help me a lot with all around computer speed. No surprise there... but I'm hoping it helps with my lag problem in league as well.

My problem isn't related to cpu/gpu/ram or internet usage; I've checked it while having "attempting to reconnect" issue on LoL, with 800+ping, and everything was under 30% usage...It's more like something is messing up with league of legends once the game itself ( not the client) start running.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=G3YQZuEd,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-01-25T02:58:27.957+0000)
>
> Since you recently updated, it could actually be a number of different things. I've seen Windows updates normally turn on the Game DVR function which can slow a lot of systems down unintentionally, so be sure that's still disabled.
> 
> Also, be sure to double check your [**firewalls**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq3) and [**DNS settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq4) to be sure they're still in order. I know you may not have changed anything, but it's better to check and be safe rather than miss something simply of course!


Today I tryed to uninstall the game, delete it's folder, and did a re-installed it afterward, but nothing;
I tried disabling the firewall, and still nothing, I keep getting this
https://i.imgur.com/0GCiiaO.png
and then After a while I can get in game, just to get the usual "attempting to reconnect" while being freezed on place with an absurd latency;
It seems that the game is actually screwing my connection.

Still nothing has fixed the lag spikes. Are all of the people using the latest update for windows 10 getting the same problem? Has anyone figured out why this keeps happening to people? I wonder if Riot or Microsoft is aware of this or not. Hmmmmmm.....

Still unable to play too...And if you ask here for help, all you'll get is the usual troubleshooting link which does nothin...

I've been spending the past few days troubleshooting this problem with some of my friends that created Blizzard Entertainment games. They've been a huge help so far on getting the lag spikes down to a minimal and making my graphics looks so much better. But I still get lag spikes none the least, with delay. It seems that there is nothing I can do on my side and I must simply wait for either Riot games or Microsoft to come out with another update to fix this problem.

As for the time being though. I am playing Monster Hunter World on the PS4, if anyone wants to join me in my games or needs help with slaying monsters, just add me on PSN. I have the same name as I do on here, GrimzReaper420.
Actually I'm going to figure this out tommorrw. I'm too exhausted to do anything about it tonight

Just as I thought... Nothing has worked so far. Guess I'll try Broporo's ideas after this bot game.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
I guess the one thing I haven't thought of trying is reinstalling League, but I doubt it will help. I'm going to try right now though.{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
